titles.title: Foreign Capital and Securities Markets Study Act of 1993

To require the Secretary of the Treasury to perform a study of the structures, operations, practices and regulation of Japan's capital and securities markets, and their implications for the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications and Finance.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on International Development, Finance, Trade and Monetary Policy.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
committee.subcommittee: International Development, Finance, Trade and Monetary Policy

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Foreign Capital and Securities Markets Study Act of 1993 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to study and report to the Congress on the capital and securities markets of Japan and their implications for and economic effects on the United States.
